name: Thunder-File-To-Link
description: A Pyrogram-based Telegram bot for downloading and streaming Telegram files via the web.

APP_NAME.description: The name of your Heroku app. This should match the app name provided during the Heroku app creation process.

ENV.description: Set this to 'True' to prevent the bot from crashing.

API_ID.description: Your API ID from https://my.telegram.org. Required for bot authentication.

API_HASH.description: Your API hash from https://my.telegram.org. Required for bot authentication.

BOT_TOKEN.description: Token obtained from @BotFather for your primary bot client. Essential for running the bot.

DATABASE_URL.description: MongoDB URI used for storing user data. This is important for database features like user interactions.

OWNER_ID.description: Your Telegram user ID, used to identify the main administrator.

BIN_CHANNEL.description: Channel ID where media will be stored. Refer to the README for setup instructions.

OWNER_USERNAME.description: Your Telegram username without the '@' symbol.

PORT.description: The port for your web application. Default for Heroku is 8080, but ensure your app reads this value.

SLEEP_THRESHOLD.description: The sleep time in seconds to handle flood waits. Optional and used for handling API rate limits.

WORKERS.description: Number of worker threads to handle concurrent tasks. Tweak this for better performance based on your needs.

NO_PORT.description: Set this to 'True' if you prefer not to expose the port publicly.

HAS_SSL.description: Set to 'True' if SSL is enabled, otherwise 'False'.

BIND_ADRESS.description: Custom bind address if needed. Leave empty for default Heroku settings.

FQDN.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name if using a custom domain. Leave empty for Heroku defaults.

NAME.description: Session name for the bot, helps in identification.

MULTI_TOKEN1.description: Optional token for an additional bot client to increase speed.
